intro: Hieracium paurocephalum, commonly known as the pale-headed hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and meadows, and it is often found in temperate regions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are yellow with a pale center. Hieracium paurocephalum is an herbaceous perennial that can spread aggressively through rhizomes, making it a common weed in many environments.
